verses.name: Acts 16:35
verses.text: And when it was day, the magistrates sent the serjeants, saying, Let those men go.

verses.name: Acts 16:36
verses.text: And the keeper of the prison told this saying to Paul, The magistrates have sent to let you go: now therefore depart, and go in peace.

verses.name: Acts 16:37
verses.text: But Paul said unto them, They have beaten us openly uncondemned, being Romans, and have cast us into prison; and now do they thrust us out privily? nay verily; but let them come themselves and fetch us out.

verses.name: Acts 16:38
verses.text: And the serjeants told these words unto the magistrates: and they feared, when they heard that they were Romans.
